As per the advisory issued by the Panchkula based Director General of Higher Education, “The State Government has decided that all universities and colleges situated in Haryana state will be closed till March 31 as a precautionary measure.”

The department of school education Haryana, meanwhile, in its order stated, “All the Government, as well as private schools situated in Sonepat, Rohtak, Jhajjar, Faridabad and Gurugram districts, will remain closed till March 31 with immediate effect, except for holding examinations.”

The students will attend the school only to take the board exams, annual exams and assessment exams. However, all the teaching and non-teaching staff members will attend the school as usual.

Several schools, meanwhile, have suspended classes or restructured them after parents expressed reluctance to send their children for fear of infection.

“Classes at our school have been suspended for 10 days now as a precautionary measure against coronavirus. Only examinations are being conducted. We have informed parents that the school has taken sanitation measures. The entire school, including its furniture and access areas, has been sanitized,” said Archana Sagar Principal Ridge Valley School in Gurugram.

“The virus is affecting the lungs and causing breathing issues. Anyone suffering from coughs and fever, along with breathing difficulties, should seek medical attention immediately. Besides, pregnant women should exercise caution both inside and outside the house in terms of maintaining personal hygiene,” said Dr Neeru Mehra, Obstetrician and Gynaecologist, Miracles Mediclinic & Apollo Cradle Hospital

“Avoid close proximity with anyone showing flu-like symptoms. Avoid contact with animals, unless vaccinated pets and also avoid crowded public places such as markets and cover your face while sneezing or coughing, or anybody near you is sneezing or coughing,” she further said.

Title: 2 more held for riots
Article:
The Special Investigation Team (SIT) has arrested two more persons on Friday for their alleged involvement in last month’s communal violence in northeast Delhi which claimed over 50 lives and left more than 350 injured.

The accused have been identified as Tanvir and Gulfam.

According to sources, the duo was found involved in arson and rioting in Northeast Delhi’s Chand Bagh area.

Police teams were looking for them after they were seen in video footages of rioting, arson and loot during the violence in Northeast Delhi. It is also suspected that duo have links with Tahir Hussain also, which will be ascertained after interrogation, said the sources.

Earlier, on Thursday, the Delhi Police said that they have registered 712 First Information Reports (FIRs) and arrested over 200 accused in connection with last month’s violence in northeast Delhi. Police also said that they have arrested seven people in connection with the murder of a Delhi Police head constable and one more arrest has been made in connection with the murder of Ankit Sharma, the Intelligence Bureau staffer in Northeast Delhi’s Chand Bagh area.

On Thursday, the Special Cell of Delhi Police had also arrested two key office bearers of Popular Front of India for their alleged involvement in anti-Citizen Amendment Act (CAA) protests at Shaheen Bagh and northeast Delhi riots.The accused have been identified as PFI Delhi president Parvez and secretary Illiyas. Sources said that investigation has revealed that they were involved in funding during the violence and anti-CAA protest in city.

Title: DPCC chief meets riot-hit victims
Article:
Newly appointed Delhi Congress chief Anil Kumar Choudhary on Friday visited and met the riots affected victims in North East Delhi. Choudhary along with other Congress leaders also supplied relief material, consisting of essential commodities and daily use items, to the riots affected families in the area.

While interacting with the locals, Choudhary said that the situation in North East Delhi was now under control, and to extend the message of peace and brotherhood, Congress workers have been having regular interaction with families affected by the mindless violence and supplying them relief material sent by Congress president Sonia Gandhi.

Choudhary also said that people should maintain peace and brotherhood as the Congress’ aim was to create communal harmony and peace among all sections of people, so that they continue to live in a peaceful and cordial atmosphere as before.

He said that Congress will spare no effort in maintaining peace and harmony in the violence-affected areas of North East Delhi.

Meanwhile, Delhi Congress vice-presidents — Ali Mehndi and Shivani Chopra — also visited Karawal Nagar, Chand Bagh, Khajuri, Mustafabad and Nehru Vihar areas and met the families affected by the violence and enquired about the welfare.

Title: 3 PFI men held for funding riots get bail
Article:
A court here granted bail on Friday to three alleged members of the Popular Front of India (PFI), including its Delhi president and State secretary, arrested for their “involvement” in anti-CAA protests and the communal riots in northeast Delhi.

Metropolitan Magistrate Prabh Deep Kaur granted bail to Mohammad Danish, Parvez Alam, PFI Delhi president, and its state secretary Mohammad Ilyas, and asked the investigating officer (IO) to explain by March 17 as to why they were not granted bail, despite the alleged offences being bailable.

“It is a settled principle that in bailable offences, it is the duty of the IO to offer bail to the accused persons at the first instance,” the court said.

It granted bail to the accused on furnishing a bail bond of Rs 30,000 each.

Alam and Ilyas were sent to a seven-day police remand last Thursday, whereas Danish was sent to a four-day police custody on Monday for interrogation in connection with last month’s communal violence in northeast Delhi.

Alam and Ilyas were arrested by the Delhi Police’s Special Cell last Thursday.

The bail order came after the police sought further custodial interrogation of the accused.

Title: 4 kill youth for turning down ice-cream during party to celebrate his MBBS feat
Article:
The Delhi Police arrested four men for allegedly killing a 25-year-old man in the national Capital on Friday after he turned down their offer of free ice-cream.

The accused have been identified as Lakshay (27), a student, his elder brother, Karan (29), a sales executive at a car showroom, their friends — Dhiraj (26), a sales executive and Avinash (27) a shopkeeper.

The accused were held within four hours of killing Amit Sharma (25). Lakshay, a student of Lala Lajpat Rai Memorial Medical College in Meerut, had recently cleared his MBBS exam and was celebrating at home in Rohini along with Karan, Dhiraj and Avinash on Thursday night, said senior police official.

“Later, the group went out for ice-cream and noticed Sharma, his brother-in-law Rahul and a friend Ishant. Under the influence of alcohol, Lakshay along with his brother and friends offered free ice-cream to Sharma, Rahul and Ishant but they turned down the offer which resulted in an altercation between the two sides,” said the Additional CP.

“The group led by Lakshay left but returned soon after and caught Sharma near Sector 3, Rohini. After assaulted him with sticks, they all fled from the spot,” said the Additional CP.

“Sharma, who worked at a lubricant manufacturing unit owned by his father, sustained injuries on his head and was taken to a hospital but the doctors declared him brought dead. The eyewitnesses -- Rahul and Ishant noted down the registration numbers of attackers’ bikes and using the information, police caught the four men within four hours of the incident. A case of murder was registered at South Rohini Police Station,” said the additional CP.

Title: 2 bootleggers held for supplying illicit liquor in Delhi, Ghaziabad
Article:
With the arrest of two bootleggers, the Delhi Police on Friday claimed to have busted a syndicate involved in supplying and selling illicit liquor in Delhi and its neighbouring Ghaziabad. Police said that they have also recovered 5534 quarters of liquor from the possession of the duo. The accused have been identified as Uday Kumar (32) and Sukhveer Singh (26), both residents of West Delhi’s Uttam Nagar area.

According to Anto Alphonse, the Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP), Dwarka district, on March 12, specific inputs were received regarding supply of huge quantity of illicit liquor on two carr following which a police team laid a trap at Sector-1, near Agrasen Hospital.

“On noticing police, the driver of the vehicles tried to dodge with vehicles but was overpowered by the police team,” said the DCP.

“During checking of the two vehicles, Honda City car and Maruti SX4, a total of 114 cartons (5534 quarter) of illicit liquor were recovered. Subsequently, a case under section 33/38/58 Delhi Excise Act was registered at Dwarka South police station and duo was placed under arrest,” the DCP added.

“During interrogation, the duo disclosed that they have brought the illicit liquor from Haryana and were going to supply in Ghaziabad. The duo further told police that during festive seasons the demands of illicit liquor to lower strata of people were increased. However, the illicit liquor could not be supplied as there are strong pickets were deployed at the borders of Delhi to prevent smuggling,” said the DCP.

“After the Holi festival, they tried to supply the illicit liquor in the areas of Ghaziabad but their luck ran out and they were nabbed by the police,” said the DCP.

Title: ‘Everyone should respect dignity of others’
Article:
Everyone should respect the dignity of others. It is our responsibility to protect the right to equality provided to citizens in the Constitution. Magsaysay Awardee and National Convenor of the Safai Karmachari Andolan Bezwada Wilson said this while expressing his views on the 'Narratives and Challenges Including the Excluded' at a lecture series 'Effective Change-Sustainable Results' at the Atal Bihari Vajpayee Institute of Good Governance and Policy Analysis.

Wilson said how we can ask others to do the work which we cannot do. After all, he/ she is also a human being. He said that my goal is to end the practice of manual scavenging. He gave detailed information about the works being carried out in this direction. He said that wherever we are and whatever position we are holding, we have to pay attention on how we are discharging our duties. There is a need for collective efforts to remove social evils.

The Director General of the institute, Parshuram said that it is necessary to think about what is happening, why it is happening and why it is not happening in the society. He said that social, political and economic changes are complementary to each other. If one of these lags behind, then there is no overall development.

The Principal Advisor of the institute MM Upadhyay, Mangesh Tyagi, Girish Sharma and the entire staff of the institute were present on the occasion.

Title: Eastern MP witnesses heavy rainfall, hailstorms
Article:
The weather conditions remained abrupt on Friday in east Madhya Pradesh which witnessed heavy rainfall and hailstorms.

During the day Seoni recorded 2 cm of rainfall while Sidhi witnessed hailstorm which suggest that the harsh weather conditions are prevailing and would remain for next 5-6 days.

Met official said that a system over east Madhya Pradesh and another over Chhattisgarh and adjoining Uttar Pradesh would maintain the weather conditions. The system would provide relief after 24 hours still weather conditions would not normalise and would take over a week.

Warning of thundery activities, lightening, speedy winds and hailstorms has been issued for Rewa,Shahdol and Jabalpur divisions and Badwani, Alirajpur, Jhabua and Ratlam districts.

Sagar division and Vidisha, Raisen, Sehore, Bhopal, Dhar, Indore, Ujjain, Dewas, Shajapur, Guna and Ashok Nagar districts have been issued warning of thunder lightening and speedy winds.

The State Capital recorded day temperature was recorded at 27.6 degree Celsius and night temperature at 14.4 degree Celsius while it would day and night temperature would be recorded at 28 and 13 degree Celsius respectively.

Partial weather conditions were witnessed in the state capital on Friday and would prevail on Saturday. Rewa, Sagar, Jabalpur and Bhopal divisions witnessed rainfall in the past 24 hours.

Umaria and Sohagpur recorded 5 cm of rainfall, Annuppur recorded 4 cm of rainfall, Dindori recorded 3 cm of rainfall, Jaithpuri and Nainpur recorded 2 cm of rainfall and Mandla recorded 1 cm of rainfall. The lowest night temperature was recorded at 10 degree Celsius at Ujjain.

Title: Political leaders welcome move
Article:
Political leaders on Friday welcomed the revocation of the stringent Public Safety Act (PSA) imposed on National Conference patron and former Chief Minister of Jammu & Kashmir Farooq Abdullah.

While Abdullah's party, the National Conference (NC), termed his release a "step in the right direction towards restoring genuine political process in Jammu & Kashmir", former Union Minister and senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said he welcomed Abdullah's "belated release".

"...I hope he will soon resume his rightful place on the front bench of the Lok Sabha, where he can address with his usual compelling vigour the issues facing his state and the state of the nation. His detention was a disgrace," Tharoor said in a tweet.

Iltija Mufti, daughter of incarcerated PDP president and former J&K Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti demanded the release of all those detained following revocation of the special status of the erstwhile state under Article 370 of the Constitution.

"Time to release all detainees including thousands of young men languishing in jails outside J&K. This has gone on for far too long & must end now," Iltija tweeted.

Senior CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury said Abdullah's release was long overdue. "The imposition of PSA on and detention of Dr Farooq Abdullah was illegal, undemocratic and unconstitutional. We have all been concerned about his health and well being. His release was long overdue".

Title: NC terms it right step for restoring genuine political process in J&K
Article:
National Conference patron Farooq Abdullah's release from detention will be a right step for the restoration of a genuine political process in Jammu & Kashmir, the party said in a statement here on Friday. The NC said the process will receive a further fillip when party vice-president Omar Abdullah and other political detainees are set free. "We urge the Government to do so at the earliest," it said.

"As the pre-eminent political party of Jammu and Kashmir, the National Conference has played a key role in strengthening the voice of the people through democracy and will continue to do so," the statement said.

Title: Scindia, Pawar, Harivansh, Digvijay, Soren in fray as nomination filing ends
Article:
BJP’s newest recruit Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh, NCP supremo Sharad Pawar, Congress veteran Digvijay Singh and JMM chief Shibu Soren are among those in the fray for elections to 55 Rajya Sabha seats to be held on March 26.

Friday was the last date of filing of nominations for the biennial polls wherein a number of the contestants are set to get elected unopposed.

Fifty-one of these 55 seats from 17 states are falling vacant on different dates in April due to retirement of sitting members, while four other seats are already vacant due to resignation of members.

Bypoll will also be held to a Rajya Sabha seat from Haryana vacated by former Union minister Birender Singh. Counting will be held on the evening of March 26, an hour after the conclusion of polls.

A keen battle is on the cards in Madhya Pradesh, where the Kamal Nath government faces a grim future following rebellion by at least 22 MLAs, as both the BJP and the Congress have announced two candidates each for the state's three seats.

Scindia and Digvijay Singh are expected to comfortably win in the polls. The BJP's Sumer Singh Solanki and Phool Singh Baraiya of the Congress are likely to slug it out for the third seat. The two parties are comfortably placed to ensure the win of one of their candidates, and while the Congress initially appeared to have an edge for the third seat, the resignation of 22 of its MLAs has made the numbers game tricky.

Apart from Madhya Pradesh, there are seven vacancies from Maharashtra, six from Tamil Nadu, followed by five from West Bengal and Bihar, four each from Odisha, Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh, three each from Assam and Rajasthan, two each from Telangana, Chhattisgarh, Haryana and Jharkhand, and one each from Himachal Pradesh, Manipur and Meghalaya.

The Trinamool Congress and the YSR Congress Party are expected to make significant gains in the 245-member Upper House after the March 26 elections. The ruling YSR Congress is expected to comfortably bag all the four seats in Andhra Pradesh, given its strength of 151 in the 175-member assembly. In West Bengal, the ruling TMC has fielded Dinesh Trivedi, Arpita Ghosh, Mausam Noor and Subrata Bakshi. Its former MLA Dinesh Bajaj has also filed his nomination and may get the party's backing.

All the four BJD candidates -- Subhas Singh, Munna Khan, Sujit Kumar and Mamata Mahanta -- are also expected to win from Odisha.

For the seven Rajya Sabha seats falling vacant in Maharashtra, Pawar and Union minister Ramdas Athawale, both sitting Rajya Sabha members; BJP's Udayanraje Bhosale, a descendant of Maratha warrior king Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, and Bhagwat Karad; Congress general secretary Rajiv Satav, Shiv Sena deputy leader Priyanka Chaturvedi and former NCP minister Fauzia Khan are in the fray.

Neighbouring Gujarat is also expected to witness a close contest with three candidates from the BJP -- Abhay Bharadwaj, Ramilaben Bara and Narhari Amin -- and two from the Congress -- Shaktisinh Gohil and Bharatsinh Solanki -- filing their nomination papers on Friday for four vacant seats.

All the five candidates in Bihar -- Harivansh (JDU), Ram Nath Thakur and Vivek Thakur (both BJP) and Prem Chand Gupta and A D Singh (both RJD) are expected to be declared elected on March 18, the last date for withdrawal of nominations.

For the two seats in Jharkhand, the ruling JMM-Congress-RJD alliance has fielded JMM chief Shibu Soren and Shahzada Anwar of the Congress.

Title: LF, Cong frown over TMC fielding ex-MLA
Article:
In what the Left and the Congress called a product of a “secret understanding” between the BJP and the Trinamool Congress the latter on Friday fielded a former party MLA Dinesh Bajaj as its fifth candidate for the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections.

While the TMC had earlier fielded four former MPs —Dinesh Trivedi,Mausam Benazir Noor, Subrato Bakshi and Arpita Ghosh — it was unsure of fielding the fifth candidate considering its strength in the State Assembly.

“Though according to the numbers we may not be able to get the fifth seat we do not say that we will not field a fifth candidate. We willtake a decision very soon,” TMC general secretary Partho Chatterjee had said on Wednesday. Bajaj is contesting as an Independent candidate backed by the TMC.

The CPI(M) which had with the backing of the Congress Party nominated former Kolkata Mayor and senior counsel Bikash Ranjan Bhattacharya for the fifth vacant seat however saw a “secret understanding” between the TMC and the BJP.

“Going by its strength in the House it can only elect five candidates. Now it has decided to field a fifth candidate knowing full well that it cannot get him victorious on its own votes… As the Congress has already supported the Left the BJP’s votes may be crucial in a tight situation,” said a senior Left leader.

Former CPI(M) MP Samik Lahiri said Bajaj enjoys good chemistry with the saffron party adding TMC’s fielding the fifth candidate was the result of secret talks with the BJP which too like the Trinamool Congress wants to block the passage of the Left from entering Parliament. “But we are confident that the CPI(M) candidate will win the elections,” he said.

Though the Left and the Congress feel Bhattacharya can comfortably win the fifth seat the experts feel that Trinamool is banking on a possible rift in the Congress over its support to the Left a party against which it had been fighting for the past more than 60 years.

“We will leave it on the conscience of the Congress MLAs to decide whether they will vote for a party which had tortured massacred its members for more than three decades of its rule,” said Chatterjee.

Experts also said that if the BJP decided against refraining from voting then its members might not prefer a Left candidate to the one from the TMC.

Title: Sena’s Priyanka Chaturvedi file papers
Article:
Shiv Sena’s deputy leader Priyanka Chaturvedi, Congress general secretary Rajiv Satav, NCP’s former Minister Fauzia Khan and BJP’s Bhagwat Karad on Friday filed nominations for the March 26 Rajya Sabha polls from Maharashtra.

Friday was the last day for the elections to seven Rajya Sabha seats from the State.

NCP president Sharad Pawar and Union Minister Ramdas Athawale, both sitting Rajya Sabha members, and BJP leader Udayanraje Bhosale, 13th descendant of Maratha warrior king Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, had already filed their papers for the March 26 polls.

The elections to seven RS from Maharashtra have been necessitated by the impending end of the terms of NCP supremo Sharad Pawar, Union minister Ramdas Athawale, Congress' Hussain Dalwai, Sena's Rajkumar Dhoot, BJP's Amar Sable, BJP-backed Independent Sanjay Kakade and NCP's Majeed Memon, on April 2.

Karad, a former Mayor of Aurangabad, filed the nomination on behalf of the BJP. He was accompanied by former Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra adnavis, state BJP president Chandrakant Patil and ex-state minister Pankaja Munde.

Incidentally, Karad is the third BJP candidate to have filed nomination for the polls after Athawale and Bhosale, who submitted their papers on Thursday. Athawale heads the RPI (Athawale), an ally of the BJP.

Though it has gone on expected lines, the Shiv Sena’s decision to nominate Priyanka Chaturvedi has sparked a debate within the state political circles in general and in the Sena circles in particular.

Informed party sources said that Priyanka had been hand-picked by Sena leader and minister Aditya Thackeray, whose recommendation of her name tilted the scale in her favour. The Sena announced Priyanka’s nomination after ignoring the claims of senior Shiv Sena leader Chandrakant Khaire.

A four-time MP from Aurangabad Lok Sabha constituency, Khaire was trounced by AIMIM’s Imtiyaz Jaleel in 2019 polls. Khaire had been lobbying for his rehabilitation by way of nomination to contest the March 26 RS polls.

Priyanka’s nomination has apparently not taken kindly by Shiv Sena MP and spokesperson and MP Sanjay Raut, who had till now become the face of the Shiv Sena in New Delhi. Now, he will have a completion in Priyanka who speaks well both in English and Hindi. In effect, the Shiv Sena will have a charming face in the national capital, in addition to Raut, who being a close aide of chief minister and Sena president Uddhav Thackeray will have a bigger say in the party affairs.

As the lone candidate of Shiv Sena, Priyanka’s election to Rajya Sabha has become a mere formality. Her election to Rajya Sabha will come as a major break for Priyanka in her decade-long political career.

Priyanka, who worked as a director of a media and public relations firm in Mumbai, began her political career with the Congress party in 2010.

After working as the general secretary of the Indian Youth Congress from North-West Mumbai in 2012, she came to be appointed as the spokesperson of the All India Congress Committee.

However, on April 19, 2019, a miffed Priyanka joined the Shiv Sena after she quit the Congress in the wake of reinstatement of some Congress workers who had manhandled her during a press conference in Mathura in September 2018 and denial of party ticket to contest the Lok Sabha polls from Mumbai.

Soon after she joined the Shiv Sena, the party leadership recognised her and appointed her as a deputy party leader.

Title: Ticket-booking jobs for youth, private agents not needed: Goyal
Article:
The Government will create railway ticket booking jobs for youths by first barring the private vendors and touts from doing the same, Railway Minister Piyush Goyal told Lok Sabha as he also informed members that vacant lands of railways would be used for setting up solar panels, producing 20,000 MW electricity, leading to zero cost on power for running locomotives.

Replying to a discussion on the demand for grants of the Railway Ministry, the minister spoke about his Ministry's crackdown on touts, including arrests, and asserted that private agents are no longer needed when most people can book tickets on mobiles.

Those who need help can go to "common service centres" which are run by Government, he said.

The touts used to book tickets in large numbers within moments of their availability using certain softwares, he said, adding that his ministry has taken action against them.

Goyal also said that on the suggestion of Prime Minister Narendra Modi , his ministry would use vacant lands available with the railways for generating solar energy. He estimated that this could generate solar power to the tune of 20,000 mw, reducing power expenditure for running trains to almost zero. The Minister said whenever land was needed for other use, it solar panels could be shifted elsewhere.

During question hour, Environment and Forest minister Prakash Javadekar said the National Clean Air Programme (NCAP) is meant to ensure that the problem of pollution is addressed at the local level and cities have been asked to prepare plans to deal with the issue.

Replying to a question in Lok Sabha, Javadekar said NCAP envisages drawing city-specific plans.

"Every city has different pollutants and the sources also vary," Javadekar said.

Replying to another question, he said water bodies in the country are polluted because 70 per cent of sewage goes untreated.

"People used to say 'Ganga maile ho gay. Papiyon ke paap dhote dhote'. But this not not true," Javadekar said citing the untreated sewage treatment as a major source of pollution.

Earlier, the Common Effluent Treatment Plant (CETP) was built and operated by different entities which created problems, Javadekar said.

"Now, we have decided that those who built and operate the sewage treatment plants are the same. They will operate the plant for 10 years," he added.

The minister also cited that the examples of water bodies in Bengaluru where sewage water is being let in without being treated and emphasised on preserving water bodies.

To another question, Javadekar said the Centre on Friday said it has permitted fencing around forest areas to ensure safety of people living in adjacent villages from attacks by wild animals. Responding to a question the nvironment Minister said the government is providing financial and technical assistance to state governments for activities like erection of physical barriers around forest areas to avoid man-animal conflict. Responding to a yet another question , Javadekar said over 300 out of 700 industries inspected by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) have been found violating environmental norms and causing pollution in the last four years.

Most of the industries which were found violating environmental norms were steel, cement, power and pharmaceutical.

However, out of the 342 units found non-complying during inspection, 293 are complying as on date, the minister said, adding that directions/ notices issued for the remaining 49 non-complying units are still in force.

Title: PC: Despotism, arbitrariness constitute rule of law in J&K
Article:
Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram on Friday hit out at the Modi Government for keeping former Jammu & Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah under detention for seven months, alleging that "despotism and arbitrariness"constitute the rule of law in the Union Territory.

Chidambaram's attack on the government came after Abdullah was released following the Jammu and Kashmir administration's revoking of the stringent Public Safety Act (PSA) against the former chief minister.

Title: Plastic raw material worth lakhs of rupees gutted
Article:
Plastic raw material worth lakhs of rupees was gutted in fire after a massive fire broke out at plastic factory in Govindpura Industrial Area in the wee hours on Friday.

The fire which broke around 4.30 in the morning soon engulfed the raw plastic material at the factory and it took around four hours for the fire tenders to completely douse the fire.

Soon after the fire was spotted locals informed the fire brigade and over a dozen fire tender vehicles were pressed into service.

As the factory was located near other plastic manufacturing units locals feared that the fire would damage massively but fire was pacified by the fire tenders before it could spread to nearby factories.

Fire officer Rameshwar Neel said that the fire was contained before it could spread to other facilities which could lead to massive damaged to the units.

In the fire no casualty was reported and no one was injured in the incident.

Initially, fire tender vehicles were dispatched from Govindpura fire stations and around a dozen fire tender vehicles and over four water tankers were involved in the pacifying the fire.

In the initial investigation short circuit was found to be the reason which was not ascertained and would be revealed later.

The fire tenders failed to found any fire extinguishers at the factory which was gutted in fire.

The owners of factories and manufacturing units have not shown interest for fire audit which was pending for long and same was intimated.

Title: Govt orders closure of cinema houses of State
Article:
The State Government has directed to shut down all the cinema houses of the State to protect the people of the state from Corona Virus. The Commercial Tax Department has issued orders in this regard exercising the powers conferred in Section 5 (4) of the Madhya Pradesh Cinema (Regulations) Act 1952.

As per the order issued, all the cinema license holders of the state will keep their cinema houses closed from March 14 to March 31, 2020.

Title: Prakash, Anwar file papers for RS polls
Article:
State BJP president and party’s Rajya Sabha candidate from Jharkhand Deepak Prakash on Friday filed his nomination in presence of senior BJP leaders. Prakash, filed his nominations in two sets at Assembly Secretary office. In both sets, there are 10–10 MLAs each as proposers. The doubt of AJSU party supporting Prakash’s candidature was also cleared as from AJSU party MLA Lambodar Mahto was one of the proposers.

The 59-year-old BJP candidate has declared his total assets at Rs 6.54 crore. In the affidavit, he declared his total movable assets as Rs 1,02,79,800 while his total immovable property was Rs 5,51,30,267.

Prakash accompanied by senior BJP leaders including BJP national general secretary Arun Singh, BJP legislative party leader Babulal Marandi, and union tribal affairs minister Arjun Munda and former Chief Minister Raghubar Das reached the Assembly premises.

After nomination Prakash looked confident as the number is with the BJP for second seat. For Prakash’s victory the party requires the support of 27 MLAs. The BJP at present has the support of 26 MLAs including Marandi. As from AJSU party Lambodar Mahto is one of the proposers the BJP is confident of getting the support of two AJSU MLAs support.

After the nomination process, BJP legislative party leader Babulal Marandi said, “We are very much sure that BJP candidate Deepak Prakash will easily win the election. We are confident that AJSU party will support us.” Marandi also claimed that the party is also in talks with independent MLA Amit Yadav and Jamshedpur East Saryu Roy.

Elections will be held for two of six Rajya Sabha seats in Jharkhand, currently occupied by independent Parimal Nathwani and RJD’s Premchand Gupta. As March 13 being the last date for nomination, the Grand Alliance supported Congress candidate Shahzada Anwar too filed his nomination making the fight interesting. Shahzada Anwar who had earlier unsuccessfully contested the Assembly election from Ramgarh thrice as Congress, JMM and RJD candidate filed his nomination accompanied by senior Congress leaders. Chief Minister Hemant Soren accompanied Anwar in his nomination process and exuded confidence that the Grand Alliance will win the second seat too.

Soren said, “The Grand Alliance will win both the Rajya Sabha seats as we have numbers.” Sources said earlier the name of State Congress in-charge RPN Singh and former Godda MP Furkan Ansari was doing the rounds, but at the last hour Congress seeing that the numbers are not in his favour decided to field Anwar who is considered as dummy candidate.

Even the MLAs are sure of Rajya Sabha elections. Senior BJP leader and former minister CP Singh said, “It is very much clear that on one seat JMM chief Shibu Soren will win, while the second seat will go BJP’s Deepak Prakash. Congress candidate Shahzada Anwar is no way in fray.”

Title: Fraudster arrested for duping 30-year-old man
Article:
The Jehangirabad police has arrested a fraudster who duped a 30-year-old man to the tune of Rs 2.18 lakh in the name of facilitating Government job. The accused was arrested on instructions of senior officials.

Police said that the victim Ramesh Kumar has been duped by miscreant identified as Bhaghirath Singh by providing fake appointment letter of job at Mantralaya and duped victim of Rs 2.18 lakh.

The victim in his complaint stated he met the accused in the year 2018 who offered him facilitating of Government job and later told him that it would require over Rs 2 lakh. Victim provided the money but for next few months he was not provided with the job and money was not refunded.

Later, the victim was provided with a fake appointment letter. The victim checked the letter with the department only to find that it was fake and started to ask for refund which the accused failed to provide after which victim lodged complaint with senior officers.

After the completion of the investigation it was found that the accused had duped the victim and the police registered a case of fraud against the accused and arrested him and started further investigation.

During the investigation, it was found that more victims would emerge after the arrest of the accused who is under police custody. Later, a case was registered.

Title: Nath urges Guv to bring back his MLAs to MP
Article:
Uncertainty continued on the fate of 19 Congress MLAs presently lodged in a private resort in Bengaluru. Amidst talks that they would reach Bhopal in the evening, Chief Minister Kamal Nath called on the Governor Lalji Tandon urging him that his party MLAs should be freed and brought back to Madhya Pradesh.

Meanwhile, the arrival of Congress rebels from Bengaluru was expected at Bhopal airport on Friday evening, but later it was cancelled.

Nath in a letter written to the governor, who returned from Lucknow on Thursday night, accused the BJP of indulging in horse trading for the past few days.

He questioned the manner in which the BJP leaders handed resignation of 19 MLAs to speaker NP Prajapati, alleging violation of constitutional procedures and transparency.

Nath in the missive also referred to Bengaluru incident in which Madhya Pradesh ministers –Jitu Patwari and Lakhan Singh were manhandled by ‘goons and Karnataka police’ as well.

Importantly, Nath mentioned in the letter that his government was open to a floor test on a date fixed by the speaker as assembly session starts from March 16.

The Chief Minister also urged Tandon to exercise his constitutional authority to ensure the MLAs held ‘captive’ at Bengaluru are freed.

After meeting the Governor Nath speaking to the media on being asked about the BJP demand of a floor test said, “You (BJP) can’t take MLAs hostage and then demand floor test.” For proving majority in the floor of the House, the MLAs should be allowed to exercise their franchise in free and fair manner, added Nath.

When asked to comment whether Assembly session could be postponed over coronavirus threat, Nath left the scene saying the corona virus has already entered politics in Madhya Pradesh.

Earlier, the Parliamentary Affairs minister Govind Singh had claimed that in the wake of corona virus Assembly session have been postponed in many states and the same is being considered in MP as well.

Singh also called on the speaker NP Prajapati objecting the manner in which the resignations of the 19 Congress MLAs were handed to him (speaker) by BJP leaders.

He also demanded a probe into the resignations of the said MLAs.

Title: Scindia files RS nomination for March 26 poll
Article:
Jyotiraditya Scindia, who had recently joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), filed his nomination papers for the March 26 Rajya Sabha polls on Friday. The senior leader was accompanied by BJP leader and former Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh Shivraj Singh Chouhan. Polls for 55 Rajya Sabha seats in different states are scheduled to be held on March 26.

On Wednesday, Scindia joined the BJP in New Delhi in the presence of party President JP Nadda. He had resigned from Congress a day earlier after meeting Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Scindia was part of the Congress Party for almost two decades.

Title: Section 144 imposed in view of likely arrival of MLAs
Article:
Amidst reports that 19 MLAs primarily of Jyotiraditya Scindia camp could arrive at Bhopal airport on Friday, section 144 of the CrPC was imposed in the Airport area.

However, a number of BJP and Congress activists had reached there. Taking strong objection to the gatherings, the police even as governor Lalji Tandon sacked half a dozen ministers on the recommendation of Kamal Nath government.

Early in the day, it was rumoured that Congress MLAs present in Bengaluru could land at Raja Bhoj airport in a chartered plane. Soon after BJP leaders and workers arrived at the airport with two buses meant ostensibly to take the MLAs away with them. Heavy police force was also deployed at the airport.

Soon Congress leaders and workers in large numbers gathered at the airport and had heated arguments with the BJP leaders and police as well. As the police saw the scuffle heating up, the district administration invoked section 144 of CrPC at the airport and BJP cadre was forced away from the scene. Fresh deployment also was sent to airport.

In between some Congress MLAs also were spotted at Bengaluru airport. However, as the drama continued at Raja Bhoj airport for hours, it eventually emerged that MLAs were not coming to Bhopal on Friday. In between Congress workers armed with black balloons and flags in large numbers had gathered to protest the attitude of missing MLAs on various places across the city.

Meanwhile the assembly speaker NP Prajapati who had served notices to six MLAs to present themselves before him to endorse their resignations left the assembly after waiting for the ‘elusive’ lawmakers for three hours.

“I waited for the MLAs for three hours and I would be meeting those whom I have offered appointment on Saturday,” Prajapati told the media. On being asked when he would meet MLAs he summoned on Friday, the speaker said he would offer a fresh date to them.

Meanwhile the senior BJP leaders including Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Jyotiraditya Scindia and union minister Narendra Singh Tomar called on the governor Lalji Tandon and had discussions on the political scenario in the state.

During the day, the governor sacked six ministers—Imarti Devi, Govind Singh Rajput, Pradyumn Singh Tomar, Tulsi Silawat, Prabhuram Chaudhary and Mahendra Singh Sisodia on the recommendation of Kamal Nath cabinet. All of them owe allegiance to Jyotiraditya Scindia.

The Ministries held by these ministers were re-allotted by CM Kamal Nath to his senior ministers of the cabinet.

Title: Annual check-up for Govt staff put off till June 30
Article:
To avoid unnecessary strain on hospitals and chances of them getting infected in health facilities, the Government on Friday suspended till June 30 the mandatory annual health checkup of its officials in the wake of coronavirus outbreak.

Annual health checkup is a must for the appraisal of all Central Government officials above the age of 40 years and is done by March 31 every year.

“We have a total of 50-60 lakh Central Government employee and a substantial chunk is above the age of 40 years for whom the health checkup is mandatory,” said an official of Department of Personnel and Training.

The official said getting health checkup at hospitals put extra burden on them besides the officials may get infected during their visits to hospitals for the exercise.

“Keeping in mind, the Government has decided to suspend the mandatory requirement till June 30 but it will not affect the appraisal process,” he said.

More than 1,30,000 cases of the novel coronavirus have been recorded in 116 countries and territories, killing at least 4,900 people.

Title: J&K shuts malls, gyms, pools, clubs till Mar 31
Article:
After second case of Coronavirus tested positive in Jammu, the district authorities ordered closure of all shopping malls, gyms, swimming pools, recreational clubs across Jammu district with immediate effect till March 31, 2020.

According to official sources, “one of the persons who came in contact with a 63 year old coronavirus patient, with a travel history to Iran, tested positive on Friday”. “The patient has been kept in an isolation ward of GMC, Jammu for last three days and is being monitored by the team of doctors”,official sources said.

According to a statement issued by Department of Information and Public Relations, “District Magistrate Jammu, in exercise of power vested under Section 144 CrPc, has ordered closure of all shopping malls, gyms, swimming pools, recreational clubs in district Jammu with immediate effect. This order shall remain in effect till 31st March, 2020. Any violation of this order shall invite action under Indian Penal Code”.

The government had already ordered closure of cinema halls, multiplexes after closing down schools, colleges and Universities across Jammu and Kashmir to prevent spread of coronavirus cases.

In another related development ,Dr Shafkat Khan, Nodal Officer Coronavirus Control Efforts was also placed under suspension with immediate effect for dereliction of duties.

A suspected coronavirus patient, with a travel history to South Korea, was discharged from Government Medical College hospital, Jammu late Thursday evening after his second sample tested negative.

According to Bhupinder Kumar, Mission Director, National Health Mission and nodal officer, a total number of 1743 travellers and persons in contact with suspected cases have been put under surveillance while as 1485 persons are under home quarantine.

He said, a total number of 85 samples have been sent for testing, of which 77 tested as negative and only two cases have tested positive, so far while as reports of six cases are awaited till March 13, 2020.

He also informed that 159 persons have completed their 28-day surveillance period and, so far, only two cases have been tested positive in Jammu and Kashmir.

Persons who are in hospital quarantine stand at 18 and 81 persons are under home surveillance, he added.

As per the latest travel advisory issued by the Central Government, all travellers having travel history to coronavirus affected countries are advised to undergo self-imposed quarantine for a period of 14 days from the date of their arrival. On its part, Jammu and Kashmir police has also launched a special drive to spread awareness among commuters using public transport buses for travel. Pilgrims arriving at Katra, base camp of Mata Vaishno Devi shrine are also being screened by the team of doctors stationed at helipad and Katra railway station.

Title: Panic after neighbour of patient dies in Kerala
Article:
An elderly man, who was a neighbour of a coronavirus patient at Chengalam here and under home quarantine, died on Friday en route to hospital and authorities are awaiting the post-mortem report and test results of samples to confirm the cause of death.

Kottayam district collector PK Sudheer Babu said the deceased did not show any signs of the virus and a preliminary medical examination showed that the death had occurred due to heart attack.

He said the deceased was a “secondary contact” of the infected person.

“We are quite sure the death was not related to the coronavirus. The deceased did not show any sign of the virus.

Our preliminary examination shows the death had occurred due to heart attack. But, we can confirm it only after the post-mortem. The person was under home quarantine,” the collector told reporters.

Babu said it was the son of the deceased who is the “primary contact” of the infected person and not the father.

According to an official, his son had come into direct contact with one of the COVID-19 patients from Chengalam between February 29 and March 8.

“The son is under observation. Neither he nor any other members of his family has any symptom of the infection now.

Yet to rule out any doubt, we are waiting for the post-mortem report and the samples have been sent for testing,” the collector said, adding the person was brought dead to the medical college hospital.

The collector convened the press conference after rumours were spread that the person who died was affected by coronavirus.

Kerala has been hit by the second round of coronavirus cases after the country's first three positive cases in the state were successfully cured and discharged from hospitals last month.

The state has reported 16 cases and 270 people are in isolation wards at various hospitals. There are 4,180 people under observation, of which 3,910 are under home quarantine.

Title: Health staff to work on holidays, leave cancelled
Article:
The Karnataka Government on Friday asked doctors and other health staff to work on public holidays also till the spread of coronavirus is contained.

Accordingly, starting from tomorrow— a second Saturday — and Sunday followed by all public holidays subsequently, they have been asked discharge their duties.

The Government issued a circular stating that certain emergency measures are being taken to control the spread of coronavirus is some parts of the State. To manage things in a result-oriented manner, doctors, office personnel, paramedical staff and other permanent and contract employees in hospitals coming under the Health Department have been instructed to work on all public holidays.

“Till the situation improves, office heads have been instructed not to grant any holiday for doctors, officers/staff.

Those who are already on leave should be instructed to return to work,” the circular read.

Title: Cases rise to 17, Maha orders closure of halls, gyms, pools
Article:
As the total number of positive Coronavirus cases climbed to 17 in Maharashtra, the MVA Government on Friday invoked the Epidemic Diseases Act of 1897 to prevent spread of the pandemic in the State and ordered closure of cinema halls, auditoriums, gyms and swimming pools in Mumbai, Navi Mumbai, Thane, Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad and Nagpur cities from the midnight.

Making a statement in the State Assembly, chief minister Uddhav Thackeray confirmed that the Covid-19 positive cases had risen to 17 in the state. Of the 17 cases, Pune accounted for a maximum 10 positive pandemic cases, while Mumbai recorded three such cases. Nagpur and Thane reported one Coranavirus positive cases.

“Fortunately in none of the 17 persons tested positive for Covind-19, there are serious symptoms of the pandemic. I am confident that if we take adequate precautions, we will be able to overcome serious medical situation we are facing,” the chief minister said.

The chief minister announced the state government's decision to invoke the Epidemic Diseases Act of 1897 ( from Friday midnight), which among other things empowers the state government to quarantine persons showing symptoms of Coronavirus , if needed forcibly.

Announcing a host of measures being taken by the state government to prevent the spread of Coronavirus in the state, Uddhav said: “Cinema halls, gyms, swimming pools and malls will remain closed in the cities of Mumbai, Navi Mumbai, Thane, Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad and Nagpur. While 10th and 12th standard examinations will go on as scheduled, we are closing schools in Pimpri Chinchwad and Pune till further notice”.

Indicating that Cinema halls, gyms, swimming pools and malls would remain closed in six major cities in Maharashtra till March 30, Uddhav said: “We have taken this decision ( of closure), as we need to take precautions for a minimum of 14 days”.

“However, we can not close down malls, restaurants and hotels. But, we request people to avoid going to places where there are crowds like malls, restaurants and hotels,” he said.

The chief minister exhorted the private companies to allow employees to “work from home” in view of coronavirus threat. He also urged the people not to undertake unnecessary tours and take steps to avoid crowds in public places.

“We cannot prevent people from travelling by trains and buses. But, we will not allow religious, cultural, political and sports events. We will not give permissions for such events. In case where such permissions have already been given, the permissions will be cancelled,” the chief minister said.

Uddhav said that in the list of seven worst-Coronavirus hit countries given to the State by the Centre, the names of United States and Dubai did not figure. “Because we have positive cases of people coming from US and Dubai, we will be bringing this to the attention of the Centre,” the chief minister said.

Meanwhile, State Health Minister Rajesh Tope has appealed to people to remain calm and not to resort to panic purchases of masks, sanitizers, medicines, etc. He said that family doctors could easily treat CoronaVirus symptoms without the need for quarantine.

In a related development, many mosques in Mumbai cancelled or truncated the traditional Friday prayers, while the BCCI has postponed the upcoming IPL tournament. Meanwhile, a flight carrying 46 Indians -- evacuated from the Coronavirus-hit Iran-- arrived here in Mumbai from Tehran on Friday afternoon. Besides the passengers, there are 17 crew members in the aircraft. The aircraft has been parked at an isolated spot on the Mumbai Airport to avoid any contact with other passengers or flights.

“All the passengers would be shifted by an Indian Navy team to the naval quarantine facility at Navy Nagar in south Mumbai,” a senior government official said

It was not known immediately as to whether there were any passengers showing symptoms of Covid-19 on board the flight that arrived from Iran earlier in the afternoon.

Title: Lord Ayyappa temple opens for poojas, devotees offer prayers
Article:
Amid coronavirus scare, the hill shrine of Lord Ayyappa here opened for monthly poojas on Friday evening.

Police sources said there were very few devotees who had come for darshan. Most of them were from neighbouring states. Devotees were informed about the coronavirus scare following which some decided not to proceed further, while some others wanted to offer prayers at the shrine, police said.

Devotees are allowed to proceed to the sanctum sanctorum only after being checked at downhill Pampa and being convinced that they do not have any symptoms of the virus, they said.

“We are not stoping anyone,” police sources said.Some pilgrims wearing masks were also seen at the temple.

The shrine will be open till March 18. The state government and Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB), which manages the hill shrine, have urged devotees not to visit the temple in the backdrop of the COVID-19.

Sixteen people have tested positive for the virus in the state. “The pilgrims will not be prevented from coming. But it is our appeal to them to desist from visiting the shrine due to the present circumstances,” TDB president N Vasu recently said.

Poojas and other rituals will be carried out by the Melsanthi (high priest). Devotees flock to the temple not only from Kerala but also neighbouring states and abroad.

Title: Armed forces need more funds for weapons: Parl panel
Article:
With Pakistan and China ramping up their military prowess, the armed forces need more funds to procure state of the art weapons but the budget for 2020-21 has provided 35 per cent less than the projected demand. Noting this fact, the Standing Committee on Defence has said “it is a considerable shortage and said such situation is not conducive for modern day warfare.”

Sharing this concern in its report tabled in Parliament on Friday, the parliamentary panel said shortage in capital outlay will affect acquisition of latest weaponry, aircraft, ships tanks and capital intensive projects land, building and other infrastructure.

“The Committee feel and desire that to develop and acquire the most modern state of the art fighting platforms, which can match Northern and Western neighbours, the requisite allocation is very essential,” the report said.

Observing that since 2015-16, none of the Services have got the matching allocation as per the projection, the report on Demands for Grants for capital outlay of defence services for 2020-21, the parliamentary panel said in modern war possession of capital intensive weapons are “pre requisite for not only tilting the result in our favour but also having a credible deterrence capabilities.”

The total capital allocation for the next fiscal as reflected in the budget presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on February one stands at 1,13, 734 crores. However, the projection by the armed forces was Rs 1,75, 702.06 crores which amounts to a shortage of Rs 61, 968.06crores.

Examining the allocation Service wise, the Standing Committee said the gap which was there in 2015-2016 for the Army Rs 4,596 crores has increased to Rs 17,911.22 crores in 2020-21(from 14 percent to 36 percent).

In the case of the Navy, the difference between projection and allocation was Rs 1,264.89 crores in 2014-15, which has increased to Rs 18,580 crores in the next fiscal(five per cent to 41 percent) and for the Air Force, the gap which was Rs 12,505.21 crores in 2015-16 has increased to Rs 22,925.38 crores in 2020-21(27 per cent to 35

percent).

Stressing the point that the Navy’s fighting capabilities depend on the high value platforms like aircraft carrier, submarines, destroyers and frigates, the panel said the allocation for the Navy(percentage)wise has seen the “”sharpest decline.””

In its remarks over the low capital fund, the Committee also said it was surprised over the fact that during the year 2019-2020, the shortfall in the projection to allocated amount was Rs 67, 541.76 crores. However, the defence ministry is convinced with additional allocation of “”meagre”” Rs 7,000 crores, the report said.

In this backdrop, the committee, therefore in “”unequivocal”” terms recommend that all-out efforts be done to give first and foremost priority to the preparedness of the defence forces. It should also be ensured that critical requirements of the Services do not suffer due to want of funds, the panel said.

The issue of burgeoning pension bill also came under the panel’s scrutiny as the pension budget has increased approximately 3.5 times since the last decade. The pension provision for 2020-21 is Rs 1,33, 825crores which is Rs 16, 014.56 crores more than 2019-20.

Title: Parl Panel OK’s Bill on mandatory registration of NRI marriages
Article:
A parliamentary standing committee on Friday approved a Bill which calls for compulsory registration of NRI marriages within 30 days.

The standing committee on External Affairs approved the Registration of Marriage of Non-Resident Indian Bill, 2019 with inclusions of recommendations made by its members.

The bill empowers passport authorities to impound or revoke passport or travel documents of NRIs who fail to register within 30 days after getting married.

The committee called for amending the proforma for registration of NRI marriage to make it “exhaustive incorporating all the germane” details related to passport, visa or permanent resident card and address in foreign country with proof.

It strongly recommended that the efforts must be intensified to establish better coordination with the member countries of Hague Convention and to take up the issues of NRI marital disputes during bilateral meetings and consular dialogue with foreign countries.

The committee also noted that 5,298 complaints have been received related to NRI marital grievances between January 1, 2016 and October 31, 2019.

The bill was brought in by former External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj amid reports of Indian women being victims in fraudulent marriages with NRIs.

The bill proposes to provide for compulsory registration of marriage by an NRI within a period of 30 days from the date of marriage. It also seeks to amend the Passport Act, 1967 and the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

The proposed amendment of the Passport Act, 1967 empowers the passport authority to impound or cause to be impounded or revoke a passport or travel document of an NRI, if it is brought to his notice that the NRI has not registered his marriage within a period of 30 days from the date of marriage.

The proposed amendments to the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 would also empower the courts for issuance of summons, warrants through the specifically designated website of the Ministry of External Affairs. It further provides for attachment of the properties, both movable and immovable, belonging to a proclaimed offender.

Title: Screening must for RSS workers before Pratinidhi Sabha meet
Article:
All Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) workers and office bearers will have to undergo screening for coronavirus before attending the three-day meet Akhil Bharatiya Pratinidhi Sabha (ABPS) — the highest decision-making body of the organisation—in Bengaluru, starting March 15.

The annual meeting of the ABPS will decide on the organisation's future course of action.

The confluence this time would see participation of around 1,500 elected representatives of RSS and associated organisations.

The Health Ministry on Friday put the number of coronavirus cases in the country at 75, which includes a 76-year-old man from Kalaburagi in Karnataka who became the country's first coronavirus fatality. The State has five coronavirus patients.

Taking note of the rising threat of coronavirus, RSS's Prachar Pramukh (joint publicity chief) Narender Thakur said it is mandatory for RSS workers and office bearers to undergo screening for coronavirus before attending the ABPS meeting.

Even security personnel and journalists covering the meeting will be screened, he said, adding the Sangh has made all necessary arrangements in this regard.

Apart from Karnataka, Delhi has reported six positive cases and Uttar Pradesh 10. Karnataka has five coronavirus patients, Maharashtra 11 and Ladakh three.

Title: CRPF postpones raising day event
Article:
The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) on Friday postponed its 81st raising day celebrations planned to be held on March 19 in view of the coronavirus pandemic.

The 3.25 lakh strong force had planned to hold the main ceremonial parade and display of martial skills with the involvement of thousands of troops at its officers academy campus in Gurgaon.

“Conforming to precautionary advisory to break the spread of COVID-19, all CRPF programs in connection with CRPF raising day and passing out parade of 51st batch DAGOs (directly appointed gazetted officers) have been postponed,” the paramilitary said in a statement.

“CRPF has joined the national response against COVID-19 by gearing up its medical facilities,” it added.

The passing out parade of its latest batch of officers was scheduled to be held after the raising day event on March 21.

In a similar action, the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) had last week postponed its anniversary day celebrations scheduled for Friday.

However, the CISF is now mulling to hold this event on March 28 after reviewing the threat posed by the disease that has been declared a global pandemic by the World Health Organisation (WHO).

“The Union Home Ministry has issued express orders to all the forces under its command to avoid large congregations like these events and the CISF raising day will be postponed further if the coronavirus situation does not improve,” a senior official said.

Title: Hearing on urgent cases only: SC
Article:
Taking note of global pandemic novel coronavirus (COVID-19), the Supreme Court on Friday decided that from March 16 it will take up for hearing only urgent matters and no persons except lawyers concerned will be allowed inside its courtrooms.

The apex court, which has been mulling over the issue in its meetings held at the residence of Chief Justice of India S A Bobde on Thursday and Friday, took note of the government's March 5 advisory cautioning against mass gatherings in view of the fact that the World Health Organisation has declared COVID-19 a “global pandemic”.

The apex court's notification, issued by its secretary general Sanjeev S Kalgaonkar, said it has been decided that its functioning shall be restricted to urgent matters with such number of benches as may be found appropriate.

“On reviewing the advisory issued by the Government of India and in view of the opinion of public health experts including medical professionals and also considering the safety and welfare of all the visitors, litigants, lawyers, court staff, security, maintenance and support staff, student interns and media professionals, the Competent Authority has been pleased to direct that the functioning of the courts shall be restricted to urgent matters with such number of benches as may be found appropriate,” the notification said. “It is hereby notified that no persons except the lawyers who are going to act in the matter, that is either for argument or for making oral submissions or to assist along with one litigant only, shall be permitted in the court room,” it said, adding that the mentioning of matters for urgent hearing will be made only before the mentioning officer.

The apex court has sought others' cooperation in this regard considering the importance of the safety measures to maintain public health.

Title: Modi in stupor: Rahul's attack on virus, economy
Article:
Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Friday continued attacking the Government over the spread of coronavirus in the country saying the Modi dispensation was in a “stupor” and the economy would be destroyed if a strong action is not taken. Describing the contagious disease as a “huge problem”, he said ignoring it was a “non-solution”.

“I will keep repeating this. The coronavirus is a huge problem. Ignoring the problem is a non solution,” Rahul said in a tweet.

“The Indian economy will be destroyed if strong action is not taken. The government is in a stupor,” the former Congress chief said. He also retweeted his February 12 post in which he had said coronavirus is a huge threat to the people.

On March 3, he had tweeted there are moments in the life of every nation when its leaders are tested. “A true leader would be completely focused on averting the massive crisis about to be unleashed by the virus on India and its economy,” Rahul stated in a tweet.

At that time, he had also tagged his February 12 post in which called coronavirus “an extremely serious threat to our people and our economy”. “My sense is the Government is not taking this threat seriously,” he had said.

Title: No question of curtailing session: Union Minister
Article:
Amid reports of an early conclusion of the ongoing Budget Session of Parliament due to the rising scare of coronavirus, Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi on Friday asserted that there was no question of curtailing of the session. “There is no question of curtailing the Budget Session. The session will not be curtailed,” Joshi said. The Budget Session started on January 31 and then it went on recess on February 11. It resumed on March 3 and will conclude on April 2.

On Thursday, some members had sought Speaker to get thermal scanning system installed in the Parliament house as a precautionary measure .

Almost no business could be transacted during three days of the current budget session due to Opposition's demand to have an immediate discussion on the Delhi riot which claimed 53 lives with the government insisting that the debate could be held after the festival of 'holi' when passions would have subsided. The debate eventually took place after the festival on March-11 & March 12.

Speaker Om Birla, this week, asked members whether they are ready for the Lok Sabha proceedings during Saturday and Sunday to make up for the loss of man-days to which members did not agree to apparently due to their own preoccupations back home .

Post-Delhi riot debate, the proceedings in Parliament had a smooth run and some of the pending bills were introduced and passed with due discussions. The rapid pace development in Madhya Pradesh with a demand for test of majority in the state assembly did not have its adverse echo in the Lok Sabha which continued with its question and zero hours without any disturbances.

Title: Landlord ousts three nurses for taking care of patients
Article:
Three male nurses, who were taking care of coronavirus affected patients at the Kottayam medical college hospital, were asked to vacate their rented home by their landlord. The three were working in different shifts.

When they completed their shifts this morning and went home for taking rest, the house owner asked them to vacate, one of them said. The landlord could not be reached for comments. When a television channel aired their plight, it came to the notice of the Kottayam district collector PK Sudheer Babu who made arrangements for their stay at the medical college quarters.

Title: Prisoners in Kerala to make masks
Article:
Kerala Government on Friday decided to use the tailoring units in prisons of the State to deal with the shortage of masks following the coronavirus scare.Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said the central jails of the state would begin the manufacture of masks soon.

“Since there is a shortage of masks in Kerala due to coronavirus scare, the state government has decided to manufacture them at the tailoring units in the prisons,” he said.

In a Facebook post, Vijayan said, “Kannur, Viyyur and Thiruvananthapuram central jails will immediately start producing the masks.”

Title: Centre approves 4% hike in DA for Govt employees
Article:
The Union Cabinet on Friday approved four per cent increase in dearness allowances (DA) for Government employees and pensioners.

The move will benefit over 45 lakh employees and 65 lakh pensioners. The DA will come into effect retrospectively from January 1, 2020.

The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has approved to release an additional installment of DA to central government employees and dearness relief (DR) to pensioners with effect from January 1, 2020, an official statement said. There will be an increase of 4 per cent over the existing rate of 17 per cent of the basic pay/pension to compensate for price rise, it added.

“The combined impact on the exchequer on account of both dearness allowance and dearness relief would be Rs 12,510.04 crore per annum and Rs 14,595.04 crore in financial year 2020-21 (for a period of 14 months from January 2020 to February 2021),” the statement said. It will benefit about 48.34 lakh central government employees and 65.26 lakh pensioners.

“The increase is in accordance with the accepted formula, which is based on the recommendations of the 7th Central Pay Commission,” it added.

Title: ICICI Bank to infuse Rs 1K cr in Yes Bank as part of bailout plan
Article:
ICICI Bank on Friday said it will invest Rs 1,000 crore in Yes Bank as part of the RBI’s reconstruction plan for the crisis-hit lender. The decision was taken at ICICI Bank’s board meeting held on Thursday.

“The Board... Accorded approval for an equity investment of up to Rs 10 billion in equity shares of Yes Bank Limited, comprising up to 1 billion equity shares at a price of Rs 10 per share, under the proposed Scheme of Reconstruction of Yes Bank Limited under the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, subject to regulatory and government approval,” ICICI Bank said in a regulatory filing.

This investment will result in ICICI Bank Ltd holding in excess of 5 per cent shareholding in Yes Bank, with the final shareholding to be determined based on the final Scheme of Reconstruction and share issuance thereunder, it added.

Title: HDFC to invest Rs 1,000 cr in Yes Bank
Article:
Mortgage lender HDFC Ltd will invest Rs 1,000 crore into cash-strapped Yes Bank for an equity stake as per the RBI-mandated reconstruction scheme for the troubled lender.

“The Corporation is investing in 100 crore equity shares of Rs 2 each of Yes Bank for a consideration of Rs 10 per share (including Rs 8 premium) for an aggregate consideration of Rs 1,000 crore,” HDFC Ltd said in a regulatory filing.

This investment is likely to result in the Corporation (Housing Development Finance Corporation) holding in excess of 5 per cent shareholding in Yes Bank, with the final shareholding to be determined based on the final Scheme of Reconstruction and share issuance thereunder, it said.

As per the Scheme of Reconstruction, 75 per cent of the total investment by the Corporation would be locked in for three years.

Title: Axis Bank board OK’s Rs 600 crore capital infusion in Yes Bank
Article:
Axis Bank on Friday said it will invest up to Rs 600 crore in Yes Bank for up to 60 crore shares as part of the reconstruction plan for the cash-strapped peer lender.

“The Board of Directors of Axis Bank Ltd at its meeting held today has accorded approval to invest a sum of up to Rs 600 crore for acquiring up to 60 crore equity shares of Rs 2 each of Yes Bank Limited, for cash, at a premium of Rs 8 per equity share, under the proposed Scheme of Reconstruction of Yes Bank Limited under the Banking Regulation Act, 1949,” Axis Bank said in a regulatory filing.

The government on Friday approved a bail out plan for Yes Bank proposed by the Reserve Bank under which SBI would infuse Rs 7,250 crore in the lender for 49 per cent equity. ICICI Bank will infuse Rs 1,000 crore in the troubled lender in lieu of picking-up 100 crore shares.

Title: Business Corner
Article:
Due to Corona, GDA postpones many programs

Ghaziabad: Keeping in mind the threat of coronavirus, the Ghaziabad Development Authority GDA has postponed many of its programs till further orders. The GDA has also issued an internal advisory in this regard. Accordingly, in out door programs where five or five hundred more people are together, those programs have been asked to postpone immediately. Apart from this, orders have been issued to postpone these door programs where two hundred or more people gather together. In this episode, the opening ceremony of the Open Theater to be held in the City Forest on March 21 has also been postponed. This information was given on Friday by GDA Vice-President Kanchan Verma. She said that GDA is an organisation where a large number of out door-in-door programs are organized, so this advisory has been issued. She said that this decision has been taken according to the advice rules of WHO Verma said that this advisory will not have any effect on the auction process in the GDS every Saturday in the auditorium room, due to the low number of bidders during the auction process.

BSES bags diamond award

New Delhi: BSES discoms have won coveted awards at the recently concluded India Smart Grid Forum (ISGF) Smart Innovation Awards. BSES Rajdhani Power Limited (BRPL) won the prestigious ‘diamond’ award for the ‘Most Reliable Supply of Electricity by Utility in India’. It was received by BRPL CEO Amal Sinha. On the other hand, BSES Yamuna Power Limited (BYPL) won the ‘platinum’ award for the ‘Best Smart Grid Project in India by Utility’ for its ‘Grid connected Smart Energy Storage System with Solar Rooftop Microgrid’.

ARTISANS TRAINING PROGRAMME organised

New Delhi: Bureau of Indian Standards organised a two-day Artisans Training Programme for Hallmarking in New Delhi recently. In the first phase of this programme, artisans were informed about Hallmarking scheme and the “benefits of Hallmarking registration” would be for the jewellers. The artisans were told about importance of soldering process while making the jewellery and the hazards of the Cadmium based soldering materials. Participants were educated about the alternatives available which are considered safe. The artisans actively participated in an open house discussion and informed BIS officials about their difficulties regarding Hallmarking which were resolved by BIS officials to the utmost satisfaction.

WINGS INDIA 2020 takes off at Begumpet Airport

Hyderabad: KT Rama Rao, Minister for Industries & Commerce, Government of Telangana inaugurated “Wings India 2020”, Asia’s largest civil aviation event on Friday at Begumpet Airport, Hyderabad in presence of MK Rao, Minister of Civil Aviation, Puducherry, Arvind Singh, Chairman, AAI and Usha Padhee, Joint Secretary, Minister of Civil Aviation, GoI. The international event is jointly organised by Ministry of Civil Aviation, Govt. of India, AAI and FICCI with participation from top leaders, special invitees, Foreign Ministers for civil aviation and global CEOs, suppliers, strategic partners, organisations and the media.

OBC conducted Bankers’ Committee Meeting

New Delhi: The 98th State Level Bankers’ Committee Meeting was convened by Oriental Bank of Commerce SLBC Convener-NCT Delhi on 13.03.2020. The meeting was chaired &addressed by Sh. Mukesh Kumar Jain Managing Director & CEO Oriental Bank of Commerce, Ajay Kumar, Regional Director, RBI, Jasmine James, Dy. Secretary, DFS, Ministry of Finance, Sukesh Kumar Gupta, Convener, SLBC, NCT of Delhi & Field General Manager, Anita Patnaik, General Manager, RBI Manoj Kumar, Dy. Secretary, Govt of NCT of Delhi, V Singh, SDM-HQ, Revenue Dept. & Bhaskar Pant, General Manager NABARD.

Title: CBI books Yes Bank founder, wife & others in fresh case
Article:
The CBI has booked Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor, his wife Bindu and Avantha Group promoter Gautam Thapar and unknown officials in a fresh case under Indian Penal Code Sections relating to criminal conspiracy and cheating besides relevant provisions of the Prevention of Corruption case.

The case relates to the Amrita Shergill bungalow deal and alleged bribe for relaxation in realisation of loans worth over Rs 1,900 crore from Avantha Group companies.

Besides Kapoor, Bindu and Thapar, the CBI has named Avantha Realty Ltd and Bliss Abode run by Bindu as accused in the FIR.

The CBI on Friday conducted searches in Delhi and National Capital Region besides Mumbai at multiple locations, including the office and residences of Kapoor, his wife Bindu, office of Bliss Abode linked to Bindu, Avantha Realty Ltd, and another private company.

“It was alleged that Rana Kapoor conspired with other FIR-named accused to obtain illegal gratification in the form of a Bunglow at Amrita Shergill Marg, New Delhi by paying only Rs 378 crore (approx.) through Bliss Abode Pvt Ltd, where Rana’s wife was one of the two Directors,” an official said.

This property was immediately thereafter mortgaged to India Bulls Housing Finance Ltd for a loan of Rs 685 crore (approx.). It was further alleged that much less consideration than the market value was paid to Avantha Realty Ltd for relaxation in other existing loans of Avantha Group of companies and for advancing new/additional loans to Avantha Group of companies, the official added.

“The facts relating to criminal conspiracy establish obtaining illegal gratification to the tune of Rs 307 crore by Rana Kapoor, then MD and CEO OF Yes Bank Ltd (YBL) by acquiring an expensive property situated at a prime location in New Delhi at 40, Amrita Shergill Marg at a price of Rs 378 crore against the decalred value of Rs 685 crore by Bindu Kapoor and Rana Kapoor themsleves in lieu of favours extended by YBL to Avantha group companies promoted by Gautam Thapar,” reads the FIR.

“Information further reveals that YBL headed by Rana Kapoor did not press for sale of any other property of Avantha Group companies in its charge kept as collateral for the purpose of recovering outstanding loans even when other loans of AG (Avantha Group) companies became stressed and (turned) NPA (Non Performing Assets),” the FIR alleged.

YBL (Yes Bank Ltd) at the instance of Rana Kapoor, rather extended further credits of Rs 515 crore to Oster Buildwell Pvt Ltd and Rs 650 crore to Solaris Chemtech Industries Ltd after property at 40, Amrita Shergill Marg had been purchased by Bliss Abode Pvt Ltd in 2017. These loans are yet to be repaid to YBL and there is stated to be a total outstanding of 1,900 crore against various credit facilities extended by YBL to AG companies by January, 2020, according to the contents of the FIR.

“Information further reveals that two other companies related to Bindu Kapoor, wife of Rana Kapoor namely, Imagine Estate Pvt Ltd and Imagine Home Pvt Ltd took further loans totaling to Rs 310 crore from IBHFL (Indiabulls Housing Finance Ltd) by placing property at 40, Shergill Marg, New Delhi as collateral. …Hence a total loan of Rs 685 crore had been obtained by companies in which Smt Rana Kapoor (Bindu Kapoor) was a Director from IBHFL by placing above property as collateral,” added the FIR.

Title: Markets test investors’ nerves with wild swings
Article:
Markets took investors on a gut-churning ride on Friday, with trading being halted for the first time in 12 years as benchmarks plunged over 10 per cent in opening trade, before staging an emphatic comeback powered by banking, finance and energy stocks.

The BSE and NSE suspended trading for 45 minutes a little past 9.20 am after the Sensex and Nifty plunged in tandem with global markets as the coronavirus pandemic triggered recession fears.

However, domestic indices surged after trading resumed as investors snapped up recently-battered stocks available at attractive valuations. Expectations of stimulus measures by the US and other countries also buoyed sentiment, analysts said.

Recovering over 5,380 points from its intra-day low of 29,388.97, the BSE Sensex ended 1,325.34 points or 4.04 per cent higher at 34,103.48.

Similarly, the NSE Nifty settled 365.05 points, or 3.81 per cent, up at 9,955.20. It hit an intra-day low of 8,555.15.

Title: Parl OK’s ‘Vivad Se Vishwas’ Bill
Article:
Parliament on Friday approved a Bill that will provide an opportunity to taxpayers to settle disputes by paying due taxes with a complete waiver of interest and penalty till March 31.

The Direct Tax Vivad Se Vishwas Bill was passed by voice vote and returned by the Rajya Sabha as it was a money bill. It was approved by the Lok Sabha on March 4.
